title: Why was Russia interested in the Balkans WW1? - Quora

response.answer_text: Russia was the main centre of pan-slavism in Europe. It looked on southern slavs (residing in balkans) as its brothers. Some countries in Balkans were under Hapsburg (Austria-Hungary) empire, some under Ottoman and some like Serbia, Greece were free. Croatia was under Hapsburgs. When prince of Austria visited Croatia, Serbian nationalists asassinated him in Sarajevo. This led to Austria declaring war on Serbia. Germany sided with Austria and Russia sided with fellow slav nation- Serbia.
